meanings.definition: Stanchioning (verb): the act of supporting or securing something with stanchions.
meanings.sent1: The workers were stanchioning the stage for the concert.
meanings.sent2: She stanchioned the fence to keep the dog from running away.
meanings.sent3: The magician stanchioned the disappearing box to prevent any unexpected surprises.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like stanchioning his dreams in place, unyielding to doubts.
meanings.sent5: The vines stanchioning the garden gate added a rustic charm to the entrance.

meanings.definition: Stanchioning (noun): a stanchion or upright post used for support or as a barrier.
meanings.sent1: The event organizers set up the stanchioning to guide the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The metal stanchioning marked the boundaries of the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the stanchioning as a lookout post for acorn storage.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood tall, its roots like the stanchioning of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The antique shop displayed beautiful stanchioning from historic buildings as decor.
